Package assignmentJava

Class Network

java.lang.Object
assignmentJava.Network
public class Network extends Object
This is the backbone class of the program. Contains all the necessary entities and orders and provides methods to allow interoperability between these classes. Handles order processing.

    • uniqueIDs

      @NotNull private final @NotNull List<Integer> uniqueIDs
      Deprecated.
      Not needed right now since the system uses auto-generated unique IDs that are guaranteed to be distinct.
      A list of unique IDs that have been created so far. When a new entity is added to the system, its unique ID will be added to this list. When the entity is deleted, its unique ID will continue to stay in this list, since future additions should NOT have unique IDs that belonged to deleted entities.

    • processOrder

      public void processOrder(@NotNull @NotNull Integer orderID) throws InvalidOrderException
      Process an order by using the following algorithm. 1. Choose a delivery agent with the least number of product deliveries the same zipcode as the customer. 2. If no such delivery agent exists, throw an exception. 3. Else, continue, by choosing a shop/warehouse in the same zipcode as the customer. 4. A shop/warehouse is chosen only when it has the required number of products and satisfies the zipcode condition. 5. If no such shop/warehouse exists, throw an error. 6. "fulfill" the order by moving the order from the unprocessedOrders map to the processedFailed map, which contains both processed (successful) and failed orders. 7. For an order that can be "processed", call the corresponding fulfill methods on the delivery agent and shop/warehouse objects. This will decrement the inventory of the shop/warehouse, and add this order to the delivery agent's history.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The order ID of the order that is to be processed.
      Throws:
      InvalidOrderException - When the order cannot be processed or is invalid in some form.
